body_html:
Solid work @F3PiX 💪

💚 for asking for the related issue(s)

I would have put it a bit more pressing for user interaction (editing, removing, checking things), just to make sure people will at least be forced to write something 😉

Also, I would skip the "notes" part (this can be part of the description) and maybe merge "goal" and "description" as I find it very difficult to make a distinction between them without constantly crossing the boarders.

And one question: what do you mean with "Test/outcome"?

Here my more interactive version (raw .md)

<!--- link targeted issue(s) and describe what this is doing --->

#### preflight checklist 🚀
*[ ] tests added
*[ ] screenshot, gif or video added (only if changes to the UI)

I know this ☝️ looks super short 😂 but for me it covers the key things _(I also don't wanna overwhelm people and make this a huge effort...)

Quick explanation why I wrote it like this: I think the <!-- ... you used has the great effect to look like a placeholder, which means none would leave it as it is, either remove or replace it (which is what we intend)
The latter two checkboxes are things I would ask for once I realize a) this code is touching "backend" logic or b) heavily changing views. So we could spare these questions and have the template ask them.
Aside from that I think the description can cover anything else, if people really have something to say.
